meanings.definition: Upheavers (noun): Those who cause disruption or disturbance.
meanings.sent1: The upheavers in the neighborhood were always starting trouble.
meanings.sent2: The police were called to handle the group of upheavers causing chaos.
meanings.sent3: The upheavers decided to have a noisy party in the library, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her rebellious nature made her an upheaver in the calm sea of the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The upheavers left a trail of chaos wherever they went.

meanings.definition: Upheavers (verb): To cause disruption or disturbance.
meanings.sent1: The construction work will upheave the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
meanings.sent2: The protestors hoped to upheave the unjust laws through their demonstrations.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children planned to upheave the order of the classroom by switching all the desks around.
meanings.sent4: Her unexpected resignation upheaved the entire company.
meanings.sent5: The sudden storm upheaved the calm waters of the lake.
